content.question: The figures above show the vectors for initial velocity <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and the constant acceleration <math alttext="a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of an object moving along the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis of a coordinate system. If the object is at position <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following figures accurately uses dots to represent the position vectors of the object during the first three seconds of its motion?

choices.label: The figure presents 4 evenly spaced dots in a row. The dots are labeled, from left to right, t equals 0, t equals 1 second, t equals 2 seconds, and t equals 3 seconds.

The figure presents 4 dots in a row with spacing that decreases from left to right. The dots are labeled, from left to right, t equals 0, t equals 1 second, t equals 2 seconds, and t equals 3 seconds.
The figure presents 4 evenly spaced dots in a row. The dots are labeled, from left to right, t equals 3 seconds, t equals 2 seconds, t equals 1 second, and t equals 0.

The figure presents 4 dots. The dots appear equally spaced in two rows, two in each row, with the leftmost dot in the top row aligned vertically above the rightmost dot in the bottom row. The dots in the top row are labeled, from left to right, t equals 0 and t equals 1 second. The dots in the bottom row are labeled, from left to right, t equals 3 seconds and t equals 2 seconds.

The figure presents 4 dots in a row with spacing that increases from left to right. The dots are labeled, from left to right, t equals 3 seconds, t equals 2 seconds, t equals 1 second, and t equals 0.

content.answer: The figure presents 4 dots in a row with spacing that decreases from left to right. The dots are labeled, from left to right, t equals 0, t equals 1 second, t equals 2 seconds, and t equals 3 seconds.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
